javelin.controller.fight

Interface Fight

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ExhibitionFight, IncursionFight, LairFight, PlanarFight, RandomDungeonEncounter, RandomEncounter, Siege, TownSiege

    public interface Fight
    A battle scenario. TODO turn into class with fields?

    • Method Detail

      • getel

        int getel(JavelinApp javelinApp,
          int teamel)
        Returns:
        an encounter level for which an appropriate challenge should be generated.
        See Also:
        ChallengeRatingCalculator

      • getscreen

        BattleScreen getscreen(JavelinApp javelinApp,
                       BattleMap battlemap)
        TODO as much as possible should move controller behavior from the screen to this interface.

      • getmonsters

        java.util.List<Combatant> getmonsters(int teamel)
        Returns:
        The list of monsters that are going to be featured in this fight. If null, will then use getel(JavelinApp, int).

      • meld

        boolean meld()
        Returns:
        true if Meld should be generated.

      • getmap

        Map getmap()
        Returns:
        map this battle is to happen on or null for one to be generated.

      • friendly

        boolean friendly()
        Returns:
        If true will remove opponents at first sign of blood instead of at negative hit points.

      • rewardgold

        boolean rewardgold()
        Returns:
        If false will not reward gold after victory.

      • hide

        boolean hide()
        Returns:
        true if there is a chance for the Squad to hide and avoid this combat. This doesn't make sense for Sieges for example since they are actually engaging the enemy.

      • canbribe

        boolean canbribe()
        Returns:
        true if this fight is susceptible to Skills.diplomacy.

      • bribe

        void bribe()
        Called in case of a succesful bribe.
        See Also:
        canbribe()
